intro: Psoralea cyphocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense spikes, which are typically borne in the leaf axils. Its seeds are enclosed in pods that mature into a distinctive, inflated structure. Psoralea cyphocalyx is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
